summary: Amazon is investing $10 billion to create data centers in North Carolina . The move is aimed at expanding its artificial intelligence and cloud computing technology capabilities . It will also significantly boost its presence in the state, creating at least 500 new high-skilled jobs .  Amazon has been racing to invest in its artificial intelligence infrastructure . In January, Amazon Web Services announced plans to invest an estimated $11 billion to expand its infrastructure in Georgia . Big tech companies have invested tens of billions of dollars in AI .  Jassy: "If your customer experiences aren’t planning to leverage these intelligent models, their ability to query giant corpuses of data and quickly find your needle in the haystack, you will not be competitive"

Amazon is forming a new group at its Lab126 device unit focused on creating warehouse robots that will perform multiple tasks when prompted . Using so-called agentic AI, these robots will be able to unload trailers and then retrieve parts for repairs . "For our customers, it's, of course, faster delivery," said the unit's leader, Yesh Dattatreya .  Agentic AI has become one of the hot investment areas with technologists promising software that can make decisions and act upon them without additional input from users . Amazon is also using generative AI to create more advanced maps for its delivery drivers, so that they can more efficiently deliver packages .  Amazon is developing eyeglasses for delivery drivers . The company hopes to outfit drivers with screen-embedded glasses that free their hands from GPS devices and give them turn-by-turn directions . The technology could be used in the eyeglass project Reuters reported exclusively last year .  Amazon said AI will help it more efficiently predict what products customers will need and where to improve its same day delivery operations . Software considering factors such as price, convenience, weather and sales events like Prime Day .

Goldman Sachs Managing Director Eric Sheridan said while talking to CNBC in a latest program that AI capex is not showing signs of slowdown . He mentioned spending guidance of Amazon.com, Inc. (NASDAQ:AMZN), among other major tech companies .

Centrus Energy jumped 8.8% through 3:15 p.m. ET Wednesday on (potentially) terrific news for thenuclear power industry . Amazon (and Meta Platforms) are going full speed ahead in setting up new data centers for artificial intelligence (AI) Centrus helps to enrich the uranium that fuels those nuclear power plants .  Amazon is building data centers in North Carolina to support its own AI infrastructure . Amazon could spend $100 billion this year on capital improvements in general, AI infrastructure in particular . If AI is growing, then the need for nuclear power plants to fuel that growth -- and for enriched uranium -- will grow as well . AST SpaceMobile shares rose 13.1% today, as of 2:20 p.m. ET . An AST board member posted a picture on Instagram with Jeff Bezos last night . Wall Street analyst speculated the picture could mean a closer relationship between AST and Blue Origin .  Analyst speculates that AST's RF wireless service could complement Kuiper's broadband technology, and therefore make sense for an acquisition . Amazon is just beginning commercialization of its project KUIper, a satellite-based project that will deliver retail wireless broadband to Earth .  AST SpaceMobile has very promising, patent-protected RF technology and agreements with major telecom carriers . It's also a pre-revenue company that may need to raise more capital at some point . However, the potential for a buyout could "sweeten" an existing upside case .  Amazon's total average return is994% — a market-crushing outperformance compared to172% for the S&P 500 . Amazon announced a $10 billion investment to expand its AWS data center footprint in North Carolina . The massive build-out will create roughly 500 high-skilled supply-chain jobs in Richmond Countysandwiched between Charlotte and Fayetteville . Move comes as hyperscale data centers have more than doubled since 2019 to 1,136 globally .  Amazon's North Carolina gambit reinforces its AI-driven lead and follows similar bets by other Magnificent 7 giants to underpin future growth . U.S. hosting 54% of global data center capacity (China 16%, Europe 15%)

Amazon announced a $10 billion investment to expand its data center infrastructructructructure . Amazon announced the investment on Wednesday . Amazon is expected to invest $10billion in the next five years .

Amazon.com experienced an 8% increase in its stock price over the last month, coinciding with several developments in its ecosystem . Recent developments, such as Amazon's AWS Generative AI Competency designation, reinforce Amazon's leadership within AI solutions . Amazon's plan to expand its AWS infrastructure in Chile with a substantial $4 billion investment showcases its commitment to growing its cloud capabilities .  Analysts’ revenue and earnings forecasts, which anticipate a growth to US$856.20 billion and US$103.60 billion by 2028, reflect optimism around such projects . Walmart’s success continues to be powered by its strong omnichannel strategy . In the first quarter of fiscal 2026, global e-commerce sales grew by 22%, thanks to more customers using online shopping . Walmart is constantly improving how it serves customers by using data and investing in technology .  At Sam’s Club U.S., e-commerce sales jumped 27%, with major gains in Club-fulfilled deliveries and pickup services . Walmart is also building out its supply chain and expanding key digital businesses like Walmart GoLocal .  Amazon keeps investing in better technology, AI and faster fulfillment . Walmart is catching up by using its many stores to quickly deliver online orders . Target relies on its unique brand and loyal shoppers to compete with Walmart’s size and low prices . The investment is expected to create at least 500 high-skilled jobs, including data center engineers and network specialists . The tech giant already employs about 24,000 full- and part-time staff in North Carolina .  Amazon did not immediately respond to a request for additional details . The company's planned outlay comes amid concerns that Big Tech companies might be scaling back their large investments . Companies have reaffirmed their commitment to extensive investments in AI .

JPMorgan unveiled a slate of top internet stocks, including Amazon, Meta, and Alphabet . Others to earn a shoutout included Spotify, eBay, Etsy, Duolingo, and Booking . The bank raised its price targets for companies across the sector as trade war concerns have abated in recent weeks .  Facebook, Instagram, WhatsApp parent could deliver revenue growth in the low teens in 2025 and 2026, JPMorgan says . The company moved its price target to $240 from $225, which implies 17% upside over Amazon's price . Google owner Alphabet was also listed among JPMorgan's top internet picks .  The music streaming giant is expected to see low-mid teens revenue growth driven by its premium subscriber base . eBay and Etsy should each benefit from China tariff relief, JPMorgan said .

Amazon stock gained 11% in May, according to data provided by S&P Global Market Intelligence . CEO Andy Jassy noted that Amazon has several advantages over other retailers in reference to higher tariffs . Amazon mostly sells low-priced essentials, which puts it in a strong position when it comes to tariffs .  Amazon is still trailing the broader market this year . E-commerce and related services make up about 68% of its sales . Amazon is working feverishly to stake its claim as the top generative AI platform in cloud computing .  Amazon stock is down 6% this year, but it trades at aP/E ratio of 33. That's just above its five-year low of 27, which it hit in April . Jassy said Amazon would spend north of $100 billion on AI in 2025, more than any other business of its type . Ast Spacemobile Inc (NASDAQ:ASTS) climbed 7.1% higher after Wednesday’s open, building on a 4.3% gain from the previous session . The rally was triggered by an Instagram post from board member Adriana Cisneros showing herself, ASTS CEO Abel Avellan, and Jeff Bezos together .  ASTS is expected to be a central customer as it accelerates satellite deployment . Blue Origin’s New Glenn rocket, a reusable heavy-lift vehicle capable of carrying 45 tons to orbit, made its debut in January 2025 . Scotiabank analyst Andres Coello questions narrow interpretation of the meeting .  ASTS is pursuing wholesale direct-to-device broadband and sees long-term revenue of $30 billion by 2033 . It is competing with Amazon’s Project Kuiper, which aims to deploy 3,236 satellites, backed by an investment of up to $16 billion .  With strategic synergies around broadband access, launch logistics, and technology assets, the market is beginning to price in the possibility of a broader commercial or financial alignment .

The artificial intelligence revolution has reinvigorated demand for its chips, even if you couldn't tell from the stock chart . The stock may not seem cheap at 33 times this year's projected earnings, compounded by analysts lowering their profit targets in recent months . Marvell turned in strong Q1 results and issued solid guidance . The chipmaker has been a solid beneficiary of the AI infrastructure build-out . The company appears to have an opportunity to get involved with custom chips for Microsoft .  Investors are worried about the company's future relationship with Amazon . Marvell is continuing to work with Amazon on its next-generation custom AI chip . CEO Matt Murphy said he expects revenue from Amazon to continue to grow over a multiyear and multigenerational basis .  Marvell's overall revenue soared by 63% year over year to $1.9 billion, while its adjusted earnings per share surged from $0.24 a year ago . Data center revenue accounted for 76% of its sales in the quarter . Marvell is supposedly involved withMicrosoft's new custom AI chip called Maia .  Marvell saw a big improvement from the large year-over-year declines they experienced in fiscal 2025's Q4 . Consumer revenue climbed 50% year over year to $63 million, while enterprise networking revenue rose 16% to $178 million . Marvell management expects the recovery in the enterprise networking and carrier infrastructure markets to continue .  The company generated operating cash flow of $333 million for the quarter, and it repurchased $340 million in stock . Management guided for fiscal 2026 second-quarter revenue of $2 billion, plus or minus 5%, which represents year-over-year growth of about 57%.  Given the uncertainties, Marvell is a bit of a speculative stock . However, given its valuation and growth opportunities with Microsoft, I think risk-tolerant investors can take a small position . Needham downgraded the stock to hold from buy, making it the latest firm to turn more cautious . Analyst Laura Martin sees a number of risks, including competition and tepid growth trends . Apple shares fell 0.6% in premarket trading . The stock is down 19% this year as of its last close .  Needham is the latest firm to sour on Apple this year . Needham says it doesn't see an iPhone replacement cycle in the next 12 months . Apple is seen as especially vulnerable to tariffs and its struggles with AI have been another headwind .  fewer than 60% of the analysts tracked by Bloomberg recommend buying the stock, a low rate among megacaps . Credit cards are powerful tools that can help you save money, manage debt and earn rewards . We'll show you how to use these cards to your advantage, ensuring you get the most value . If you're struggling to keep up with payments, a balance transfer credit card can be a lifesaver .  Tesco has matched top-runner HSBC with 33 months at 0% and a 3.19% transfer fee . The best deals are often reserved for those with a strong credit rating . Always pay the minimum monthly repayment .  A 0% purchase card allows you to make new purchases without paying interest for a set number of months . This can save you thousands compared with using a standard credit card, assuming you pay off the balance during the interest-free period . Tesco has a respectable 'Goldilocks' deal for 18 months at 0% .  M&S and Barclaycard have the longest 0% purchase deals currently, at 24 months . Make sure to pay at least the minimum each month to keep the 0% deal .  A cashback credit card rewards you with a percentage of your spending, effectively giving you back some of what you spend . For example, if your card offers 1% cashback and you spend £100 on groceries, you'll earn £1 back . Some cards require you to spend a certain amount to qualify for cashback .  A credit card for air miles can help reduce the cost of flights and upgrades . Points are usually earned based on the amount you spend and the class of your ticket . You can use points to pay for flights or upgrades, but taxes and fees may still apply .  Most credit and debit cards charge around 3% on foreign transactions, meaning a £100 purchase abroad could cost you £103 . Specialist travel cards waive those fees, letting you spend abroad at the same rates your bank gets .  There are great offers at the moment to help you avoid currency conversion fees overseas . You can even earn cashback on your spending (at home or abroad) Just be sure to pay your card off in full each month .

Warren Buffett owns nearly $2 billion of a well-known AI stock . Most investors fail to realize the company's long-term potential . Amazon actually gets most of its profits from its cloud business .  Nearly every AI application requires cloud infrastructure to train and deploy the models necessary to function . Amazon's Amazon Web Services division is the primary contributor of Amazon's profitability . AWS contributes less than 20% of total sales, but is a primary contributor to Amazon's profits .  Amazon's scale gives it durable competitive advantages across the board, especially when it comes to cost, reach, and sourcing high-demand, low-supply chips . Worldwide spending on AI is expected to reach $632 billion by 2028, growing at a rate of 29% annually .  80% to 90% of data center GPUs use Nvidia's products . Amazon has a competitive advantage due to scale, while Nvidia's position is mostly due to technological superiority and software lock-in . Amazon's position, meanwhile, may actually strengthen over time due to compounding scale advantages .  Amazon won't generate magnificent returns, but growth in AWS makes the stock a long-term buy . Seniors on Medicare can now use PillPack from Amazon Pharmacy, a service that pre-sorts medication packets before sending them to consumers’ homes . Amazon also announced a new feature allowing customers to invite caregivers to manage medications on their behalf . The new offerings appear geared at enticing the senior population .  Amazon Pharmacy expands to Medicare . Amazon says its new features will help ensure people are filling their prescriptions and make it easier for caregivers to keep an eye on medications for their patients . The expansion opens a big door for Amazon .  Amazon is one of a rash of disruptors in the pharmacy spacelooking to entice clientsfed up withrising drug pricesand opaque pharmaceutical supply chains . Most Medicare members have two or more chronic conditions —at least two-thirds of enrollees, according to government data .  Amazon has built out online marketplaces for telehealth and chronic condition management . The company has acquired medical chain One Medical in 2022 . Haven, Haven, and One Medical are Amazon's first online medical marketplace .

Billionaire Bill Ackman recently revealed that his Pershing Square Capital Management investment fund took a large stake in Amazon . Ackman was buying the stock following the market downturn after President Donald Trump's "Liberation Day" tariff announcements roiled the market .  Back in April, Amazon's stock traded down to aforward price-to-earnings ratio (P/E) in the mid-20s . Today it's back up to around a 33 times multiple . Amazon has two attractive market-leading businesses: e-commerce and cloud computing .  Amazon is using AI to predict which warehouses to store items in order to reduce travel distances . In the warehouse, the company is using computer vision to improve efficiency and lower labor costs . AI-powered robots can handle a number of tasks, such as lifting heavy objects and sorting, without taking breaks and making fewer mistakes than humans .  Amazon's largest, fastest-growing segment by profitability is its cloud computing business, Amazon Web Services . Amazon created the whole cloud computing, infrastructure-as-a-service business model out of its own frustrations scaling up its business . Today, it remains the largest cloud computing provider with a nearly 30% market share .  Amazon has developed its own custom AI chips through its Annapurna Labs subsidiary . Custom chips perform better and use less power than mass-market graphics processing units (GPUs) Amazon is investing heavily to build AI infrastructure to keep up with rising demand .  Amazon has a history of spending big to win big, and if history is any indication, it should be a big AI winner . While its valuation is not as low as when Ackman bought shares, the stock is still attractively valued . Investors can still follow Ackman into Amazon stock and be buyers at current levels . Meta Platforms is generating strong growth as its AI capabilities boost advertising revenue . The company delivered an impressive Q1, helping to brush aside market concerns about a shifting economy . The stock's several advantages relative to its "Magnificent Seven" peers may help it outperform in the second half of 2025 .  Meta Platforms distinguishes itself through pioneering innovation in social media, with over 3.4 billion monthly active users across its ecosystem, including Facebook, Instagram, and WhatsApp . Unlike hyperscalers likeMicrosoftandAmazon, whose AI strategies depend on selling cloud-based AI services to external clients, Meta's strength lies in directly applying its AI models to enhance its core advertising business .  In the first quarter of 2025, revenue rose 16% year over year . Net income soared 35% to a record $16.6 billion, or $6.43 in earnings per share . Despite higher AI investment, Meta generated $10.3 billion in free cash flow . Wall Street analysts anticipate 14% revenue growth for 2025 and 2026 .  Meta Platforms stands out as a top AI stock because of its attractive valuation . With a forward price-to-earnings (P/E) ratio of 25, Meta trades at a large discount to its Magnificent Seven peers .  Meta Platforms stock is a great option for investors seeking to build a diversified portfolio with exposure to high-level themes in technology and AI . While internet giantAlphabetis the exception, trading at a forward P/E of 18, it faces significant regulatory scrutiny . North American retail segment generated around $25.6 billion in operating income over the last 12 months . Amazon has a lot more flexibility to navigate the supply chain of its e-commerce marketplace compared to Apple . It can sell more American-made goods and still take the same fees from sellers . Amazon has many failed hardware products that burn money, but these are irrelevant to the two pillars of its business . Amazon will manage to surpass Apple in market cap by the end of 2025 . Buffett appreciates consumer behaviors and juicy capital-return programs above all else .  Nearly two-thirds of the Oracle of Omaha's AI-related investments can be traced to Apple . Despite Buffett selling 67% of his company's Apple stake since the midpoint of 2023, it still accounts for 21.5% of Berkshire Hathaway's invested assets .  The launch of its Apple Intelligence model marks its biggest step forward in the AI revolution . Apple Intelligence can be used for everything from creating emojis and images to summarizing lengthy bodies of text . Buffett's favorite thing about Apple might just be its world-leading share repurchase program .  Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world's No. 1 cloud infrastructure service platform by total spending . Buffett isn't holding $2.1 billion worth of Amazon because of its generative AI . For instance, lane departure or blind spot warnings are forms of advanced driver assistance systems . Quantum computing has emerged as one of the hottest areas in the artificial intelligence (AI) realm . IonQ, Rigetti, and D-Wave Quantum all have momentum fueling their share prices . But valuation trends suggest that these stocks may be in a bubble . History suggests that a precipitous sell-off could be in store for emerging companies fueling the quantum computing opportunity .  AI has become a megatrend fueling the stock market to new highs over the last couple of years . Semiconductors, cloud computing, and enterprise software seem to fetch the most enthusiasm . The gains in the Defiance Quantum exchange-traded fund areIonQ(NYSE: IONQ) and Rigetti Computing(NASDAQ: RGTI)  Quantum computing has emerged as a potential "next big thing" in the AI landscape . Despite little commercial scale, the total addressable market for quantum computing is expected to be in the hundreds of billions of dollars . But considering how game-changing quantum computing might be for the AI movement, shouldn't investors look past these valuation multiples?  IonQ, Rigetti, and D-Wave Quantum are only generating tens of millions in revenue while burning hundreds of millions of dollars annually . As businesses mature and diversify their products and services, they (hopefully) achieve a path to consistent profitability and begin to be valued based on earnings and cash flow .  IonQ, Rigetti, and D-Wave Quantum could see extreme levels of compression in valuation multiples . Ultimately, I think the quantum computing stocks I've talked about here are speculative . They're geared more for day traders and less appealing for investors with a long-run horizon .
